entry.entry-text: I am going to start my dog feces FMT sometime at the end of the month. Hoping to aim toward the 20th. Going to be interesting. I could get sepsis and die. I have been learning about how gut bacteria might help with dna repair. It makes me wonder if they can help.
If I'm wrong about the dog shit. i'm probably going to die. I'm scared. :(

Don't take too much at once Have some antibiotics ready to treat yourself. Have someway of measuring if it is going wrong. "antibiotics" might include enema to flush it out. Maybe iodine enema to directly kill stuff. Before you try it take a sample of what is currently inside you and do an invitro experiment with both together.
Send me a daily proof of life while you are doign your exp
ok I'm waiting on a gut microbiome test kit I got donations for
Are you alive?
I'm still waiting on a fridge to be delivered before I start my trial. I want to make sure I have food on hand in case shit goes south and I need to recover.
Good plan
Did you start your experiment yet?
no, not yet. I need to get good poop samples and a battery for my thermometer first. Been not having luck with good poops.
If you were trying to discovery something in a sample would try to keep the sample pure, avoid any contaminants?
yeah. They give you a sterile bag to shit in that covers the seat, and you are supposed to take the sample from the middle.
I don't hear from you much anymore.

I've been very bad feeling lately. That weird brain state thing is happening more and more and living back with my GF in a cramped space isn't helping me keep a healthy environment. Grumpy most of the time now and it makes me anxious to interact with anyone directly because I get angry over nothing. Some mood disorder thing tied to the multiple sclerosis.
Started the dog shit trial.
OK What measurements are you using?
Heart rate, body temp, blood pressure, SPO2, hand strength.
What about success measurements?

hand strength, body composition shifts. If i'm right about how this works, i will have improvements over a 6 month period as my body starts to trigger different epigenetic pathways. I should be able to balance on one leg regularly and not stumble to the bathroom.
Do you have a body composition scale?
yeah. I need batteries tho and need a place to use it. gonna get that in a day or two
I have a really good one. Mi Body Composition Scale. Xiomi. Their MiFit app is very useful.
I go a wiThings scale, it seemed pretty reliable
Any chemical tests?
I have an acetoacetate one to see if I get into ketosis, but that's mostly to see if i'm getting sick

This is mostly a safety trial so i'm not to worried on tests i'm gonna pick up some things I saw at walmart that can tell me drugs etc. Not sure what else they have. walgreends didn't have anything useful. I only took one pill so far and i'm waiting a few days to see if I get GI response before trying another
Good idea. Do you think monitoring liver function is good?

Dog ended up getting diarhea, but we also gave her too much of that teef thing at the same time. She was good when we stopped the teef for a bit
probably a good idea to track somethign like that via blood test. https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/at-home-liver-test#what-is-it
they are way too expensive for me to do I also struggled just getting the blood drawn for the viome thing I took. I have a before, so I can hopefully do an after I took viome and psomagen gut test (They bought ubiome's patents) a month or two ago, and hope to do one again afterward to show that my gut shifted.
Sounds good. What can I do to help you, especially if you get sick? Do you have any "antidote" on hand?
I'm fairly sure I'm good here yeah.
Keep a card with a list of what you took and what you think should be the treatment if things go wrong. If you need to go to the hospital they will need instructions.

I spent the last few months looking at antibiotic herbs and its why I made that honey garlic. I can use that, and bunch of red wine to clear my intestinal tract and then go on a fast. The wine will boost ketone levels and the garlic will flow thru my blood attacking the bacteria (if it gets in). Fasting also works well to fight bacterial infections.
I told the GF, but good point taht I should have a card.

I looked into a bunch of stuff I could get, but they all risk getting in my blood stream (even the ones that aren't supposed to) because of the crohn's issue. I'm taking a lot of care to eat in a way that maximizes my gut barrier, but if something did slip thru, the garlic + red wine seems to be comparable to stuff I could buy. I do have access to some tho if I need it.
Status?
I am fine
OK. I'll check again tomorrow.
Did you choose to handle things like your health on your own because you thought you were competent than the authorities or because they didn't have a valid solution?

I can't make it to doctors appointments becaus of my non-24-hour and gave up realized I could just research it myself, already having a lot of knowelge because of my mom's health issues meaning I needed to know a bit
Just woke up. I am doing fine. So far the only abberation has been a minor of a headache the first day. May have been unrelated, but I'm going to pay attention to it when I take the next pill.
Sounds good
Doing good today. I jus took my second pill. Gonna wait another 3 days before I take them more often.
Great
Did you miss a day reporting status?
My sleep schedule is weird.
Did the headache disappear?
yeah only had it for a day. I seem to get a bit of a runny nose every time I take it so far, but this is normal for me so IDK

All my vitals have been ok. Only issue I run into is my normal retardedness when I haven't slept in a while. If anything my bathroom use is more regular than usual. My body temp hasn't stopped below 98 F which is also odd. Maybe I've been eating more reliably than normal, tho it doesn't seem like it
Better metabolism may increase temperature.
Still doing fine. Going to take 3rd pill. A bit late, but my sleep is weird.

Good to hear. Any improvements yet?
How long do you think improvements should be measurable?
Nothing noticable. trials with autistic types took a month straight of FMT pills for them to take hold IIRC.
OK. Makes sense it takes that long.

my gut biome results were pretty fucked. heavy inflammation producting varieties. it also didn't say anything about fungus, which is what I suspect make it not work well for autistics inflammation = kill gut bacteria.

The viome test I took has some cool analysis of my blood. says my metabolic age is 37 despite being 34. lots of other neat stuff that should get me a pretty impressive showing of a shift if it does anything. https://keybase.pub/Gut%20Test/Sampled%20September%2026/ direct link to pdf https://ultimape.keybase.pub/Gut%20Test/Sampled%20September%2026/Viome/ViomeRecommendations_F9AEC9229484.pdf most of it says "not optimal", which sounds about right the biological age on page 35 is the main one I am expecting to shift as I suspect the gut bacteria will fix mTOR, IGF-1, Sirtuins, and AMPK. Its fun how they test for that
How much did that test cost?
I am predicting it to go from 37 to 32 that was 199 when I bought it. The prices change a lot

I got this kit, which does blood and poop https://www.viome.com/products/health-intelligence
They are trying to sell customized vitamin packs as a service.
TMA Production Pathways is Good, Stresd Responser Goodish

yeah, i'm happy about TMA. that means my heart is probably going to be ok TMA => TMAO is gut bacteria driven AFAICT. I have been focusing on butyrate, so it makes sense that it would be alright. I also took a psomagen gut test, but it was more just a second datapoint to confirm that my gut bacteria actually shifted. they bought ubiome's patents afaict

Vitals normal. If anything systolic blood pressure is lower than average.
Going to go to a stressful store after a long drive. Will be a good test of my mood /stress handling.
Good.
Doing ok. Kinda meh feeling but its not anything out of the ordinary. Vitals are fine.
Good. How long do you think an negative effects might take to show up? You said positive should take a month to start.
most of the negative effects would be quick - infection risk. if there were human parasites in the mix that are un accounted for, I'm not sure.
You can look up possible parasites and their lifecycle.
Risk of seeing shit (psychosis) would be driven by immune changes, but that should also coincide with fevers and other metabolic changes and GI resposnes.
Do you have a test for mental changes?
I have been making sure I can still talk to GF and she understands my requests. Logging mood and checking my iris dilation

I used a Tetris game with a high score to check myself after the head injuring. Something that also tests interpration such as art would be helpful.
OK An auditory check would be good for neurological changes. Right / left, pitch differences.

been pulling up old games that I know I should remember and seem to be able to use them without much effort.
Played dwarf fortress for a bit today and still had all the hotkeys remembered.
That seems good.

I was having issues understand GF before unless I was looking at her mouth. Thats part of the thing I do when I check that she still understands me. (see if I can understand her without looking at her)
Something a bit more precise like a set of Captchas might be a good idea. You can more precisely measure improvements.
understanding things is a good idea. I've only been using https://humanbenchmark.com/tests/reactiontime/
Document what you did. Youneed to write a paper about it.
still alive. still eating dog shit
Good to hear
update???
still alive
OK Any changes?
my diet got a bit more shit, but i'm handling it well. burritos I'm eating are making me slightly constipated, but not as bad as they have in the past.
That sounds like an improvement. I mostly avoid cheese although I eat pizza occassionally.
my gut issues make me weird. apple juice has never caused me the shits and cheese has never constipated me coffee doens't make me poop (unless I also take nicotine)
I will be visit my dad for bit.
Enjoy your visit.
Any improvements yet?
will update tomorrow, tired from visiting dad
Do you have any improvements yet?

took a week to recover from my hurting my back at dads. last time It took 2.5+ to get my head on straight, so that is nice. so not exactly perfect muscle function, but quick recovery is good because it means I can afford to risk exercising, which was one of my hopes.
OK, that sounds like improvement.

I also haven't done anything to tweak my diet from normal, so I suspect I'll be doing really good once I focus on doing real keto i used to only have clear nose only when doing keto, so that it's clear right now without it is also an improvement from baseline. no crohn's issues really to speak of either after hurting my back. normally muscle damage = inflammation that triggers a crohn's flair. so I think thats a good sign it's helping my gut. This dog shit thing was actually made to treat a form of dog diarrheia, so its not unexpected. But I wasn't confident it would work so well.

Yes, canine digestive tract is different from human. Closer than feline though. pseudo omnivore.
Have you thought about the criteria for decclaing this a success and something other people can try?
Is your health experiment working?

Yesterday I stood for an hour wihtout fatigue and managed to make food while dealing with a number of things that would normally have me shutdown. I even made a video of it. (note: personal detail removed) I ordered the Viome test for taking fecal samples and blood raitings for after. that will give me proof that it worked beyond my own general feeling.
Cool
Once I do that, i'll be switching to a proper keto diet and see if i gain muscle from exersizing. that will be the big thing that tells me it worked for real.
Looking forward to it.

I have made some significant progress on getting a way to write and publish documents on my own website using git + jekyll.
I still have to clean it up a bit more with some features that are missing, but this should soon be available on my wovensoup domain.
I just published a longform essay to see what the Virtual Assistant can find that might help with the stuff I face. https://ultimape.github.io/garden/weeds/write-drafts/longform/virtual-assistant-needs
This feels pretty significant for me given how unproductive I'd been the past year or so.

I thought I was done with the pills, but when I went to dump out the bottle I found an extra one.
Realized after the fact that 30 days * 1.5 hour drift meant I had lost a day somewhere, lol. I taste tested it since it was supposed to be the last one.
It is vaguely like a mix between a calcium pill ground up, a B-vitamin Complex, and Bile.
I did confirm that when in low concentrations it does in fact smell like flowers.
OK So you are done with the pills. How are the results? How long to determine if it didn't work or doesn't hold?
Last pill today. Then done. Would expect it to hold for a week before any of the bacteria die off from starvation.
OK, so 2 weeks you should measure improvements. Or, 1 weeks from now should be the maximum improvement. Unless it worked and you have a new vibrant culture.
I got my Viome test in the mail. Gonna wait 2 weeks. Anything that lives that long in my gut is prob gonna be happy long term
I eagerly await the results.

I don't seem to have sent the starting video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=(REMOVED)
I just published me the 'last pill' video where I taste tested it for science. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=(REMOVED)
I'm watching it

I'm looking forward to the biome test results. You probably need to do a 3rd test a month from now to see if the change was stable.
I just realized I have a device that could have been help for measuring neuralogical changes. I have an EEG system.
I could have loaned it to you.
Honestly I likely wouldn't have used it. It was hard enough to just get all the stuff together for my vitals. I had already been delayed by 2 months just with how off I was feeling.
It's good to hear that you are feeling better. It's the middle of the winter so the weather isn't likely to be the reason.

I don't wanna bust ass right now until I get the second Viome sample. But after I do I'm gonna be spending time actually cleaning my space. It's all a big pile from not being able to lift things. It took me 6 hours just to make sure I had space to keep my measurement tools together.
Huge difference from before Yeah the weather is worse! But I stopped feeling cold from it. I'm happy about that
